node.title: Hamilton goes from last to fifth in sprint race after being disqualified from qualifying, Verstappen fined
node.alt: Lewis Hamilton looks at the camera, wearing a facemask
node.description: Valtteri Bottas will start Formula 1's Brazilian Grand Prix on pole position after winning the sprint race, but Lewis Hamilton will start 10th after battling from the back of the grid, having been disqualified from Friday's session.
node.content:
["Mercedes driver Valtteri Bottas has won the sprint race to take pole position for the Brazilian Grand Prix, with\u00a0a dramatic day at Interlagos also accelerating\u00a0championship leader Max Verstappen's quest for his first Formula One title.", "Verstappen finished Saturday's sprint race in second position and added two points in the standings.", "The Red Bull driver also saw his rival, seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton, hit by another punishment. He is\u00a0now set to start from 10th on Sunday, despite an impressive run from last to fifth.", "Ferrari's Carlos Sainz finished third, with Red Bull's Sergio Perez in fourth. McLaren's Lando Norris will inherit Hamilton's fifth position on the grid. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc starts from sixth place.", "\"Starting Sunday's race from front row gives us all to play for,\" Verstappen said. \"Let's try again tomorrow.\"", "Earlier, Hamilton was forced to start the sprint race from last after being disqualified from Friday's qualifying session \u2014 where he was fastest \u2014\u00a0due to a technical infringement by Mercedes. Mercedes did not appeal against the decision.", "Despite Hamilton's fifth-place finish in the sprint race, a separate five-place penalty means the defending champion will start 10th after Mercedes decided to change his car's engine in S\u00e3o Paulo.\u00a0", "", "
Lewis Hamilton qualified fastest for Saturday's sprint race, but was disqualified so started from the back of the grid.(Getty Images: Lars Baron)
", "It was not all good news for Verstappen. The Dutch driver was fined after being seen touching the rear wing of the Mercedes car.", "He leads Hamilton by 21 points in the standings, including the two from the sprint race, with four races left this season.\u00a0", "Hamilton beat the Dutchman by more than 0.4 seconds in qualifying for the sprint race, but organisers said his Mercedes was under investigation for the drag reduction system (DRS) exceeding the maximum distance when opened.", "The technical infringement typically leads to exclusion from a session. The decision was only announced after Saturday's practice session\u00a0and before the sprint race.", "\"It was clear to the stewards that the additional deflection was due to additional play either in the DRS actuator or the pivots at the end, or some combination or other fault with the mechanism, or incorrect assembly of the parts,\" the decision said.", "\"There is therefore no question in the minds of the stewards that the test failure indicates any intent to exceed the maximum dimension either by action or design.\"", "The decision also said Mercedes argued the rear wing design had passed FIA's tests several times during the season and had always been approved. Mercedes denied having any intent to breach regulations.", "Hamilton's disqualification put Verstappen in pole for the 24-lap sprint race, which offers three points to the winner. Bottas overtook Verstappen in the first turn at Interlagos and never lost the position again.\u00a0", "", "
Valtteri Bottas passed Max Verstappen on the first lap.(Getty Images: Mark Thompson)
", "Starting from the back, Hamilton overtook rivals in every turn of the S\u00e3o Paulo track.", "Bottas said he \"gambled a little bit\" with soft tires for the start.\u00a0", "\"And then it was all about trying to survive until the end. It was quite tricky \u2026 but Max still struggled to follow in some of the corners, so I'm glad it worked out perfectly,\" Bottas said.", "Verstappen was fined 50,000 euros ($78,200) by stewards after an analysis of video taken from the grandstands at Interlagos. He can appeal against the decision given by the stewards, who said he did not harm his competitor's car with the touch.", "The video recorded by a spectator shows Verstappen apparently inspecting the rear wing on the Mercedes in the Parc Ferme \u2014\u00a0a secure area for cars at the track.\u00a0", "\"Considering the fact that no direct harm was caused in this case, in the opinion of the stewards, and that no earlier precedent of penalties for this exists \u2014 on the one hand but that it is a breach of the regulation and has potential for serious consequences on the other, the stewards determine to take action in this case and order a fine of 50,000 euros,\" the stewards said.", "", "
Max Verstappen was found guilty of touching Lewis Hamilton's car.(Getty Images: Lars Baron)
", "Article 2.5.1 of the FIA sporting code says \"inside the Parc Ferme, only the officials assigned may enter. No operation, checking, tuning or repair is allowed unless authorized by the same officials or by the applicable regulations\".\u00a0", "Stewards said the footage showed Verstappen's touch was clear.\u00a0", "\"[He takes]\u00a0his gloves off and puts his right hand at the slot-gap of the rear wing of his car. He then moves to [Hamilton's]\u00a0car 44 and repeats the exercise, touching the rear wing in two places, once on either side of the DRS actuation device, but on the bottom rear side of the wing, in the area of the slot gap and never near the actuator or the end fixation points,\" the stewards added.", "\"There is absolutely no movement of any of the wing elements on car 44 when Verstappen touches the back of the wing and the stewards are satisfied, from watching all the videos, his body position and the video of the wing, that there was insignificant force when Verstappen touched the wing.\"", "Saturday's free practice session, which was not very competitive, ended with Alpine driver Fernando Alonso clocking the fastest lap, more than 0.8 ahead of second-placed Verstappen.\u00a0", "The Brazilian GP is the third event of the season with a qualifying sprint race. The two previous sprint races were held at Silverstone and Monza.", "AP"]
